title: BETA Embedded Software Intern
description: Worked on the embedded software team at BETA Technologies, focusing on developing and testing flight software for electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft.

title: Nokia AI/ML & Automation Intern
description: Developed autonomous applications based on the OODA control loop for next-gen telco networks focusing on UPF congestion and network slice management to approach an L5 autonomous network.

title: UWARG Embedded Flight Software Lead
description: Lead of the embedded flight software (EFS) team in the University of Waterloo Aerial Robotics Group. Worked on development of firmware and embedded systems for autonomous UAVs.

title: 3Cycle Embedded Developer
description: Worked on embedded systems for automation of shredding and filament processing to develop a sustainable circular ecosystem for 3D printing waste recycling.

title: OCMC Chief Technology Officer
description: Led the technology team for the Ontario Competitive Mathematics Committee, developing the user portal from the ground up and managing the technology stack for the organization.

title: Familiarization Pilot & Flight Theory Instructor
description: Volunteered as a famil pilot on a weekly basis at a designated CFS (Cadet Flying Site) in Wingham. Also taught as a flight theory instructor at 540 Sqn on a weekly basis.

title: UW CSC Events Coordinator
description: Planed and executed large-scale events that benefitted students interested in CS, ranging from social events to fun competitions to professional networking.

title: Administration Warrant Officer
description: Managed the administration of the 540 Golden Hawks squadron for over 250 cadets, through developing an automated system to track attendance, relevant training, and more using Google Sheets and Google Apps Script.

title: White Oaks CS Club President
description: Led the White Oaks CS Club to organize events and workshops for students interested in computer science, as well as to prepare them to compete in various competitions including the CCC, USACO AND ECOO.

title: HDSB Hacks Co-Founder & Co-President
description: Co-founded HDSB Hacks, a student-led organization that ran the first hackathon across the Halton District School Board, with official backing. Over 250 participants attended the event, and over 50 final projects were submitted.

title: White Oaks DECA Finance Trainer
description: Trained students in the finance cluster for DECA competitions, and helped them prepare for the DECA regional, provincial and international levels of competition.
